issues.description: The problem statement (UML and tasks) specifies the attribute numberOfLecturers as type int, but the solution declares numberOfLecturers as a byte and uses byte in the constructor and setter parameter. This is a structural type mismatch: students reading the UML and task text will expect int for this attribute and to implement constructors/setters accordingly. Tests or graders that expect int parameters/fields/settters may fail or students may be confused about the correct type to use.
issues.suggested_fix: Make the type of numberOfLecturers consistent with the problem statement (change it to int). Update the field declaration, the constructor parameter, and the setter parameter to int in both the template and solution. Ensure the getter/setter signatures and any uses (toString, etc.) consistently use int so students and automated tests follow the UML/specification.
